message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Nitric oxide synthase uses arginine as a substrate to produce nitric oxide. The dilation of blood vessels and decrease in blood pressure are consistent with the known effects of nitric oxide on the cardiovascular system. Histidine and tyrosine are not substrates for nitric oxide synthase, and leucine is not involved in the production of nitric oxide.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, only arginine is known to be a substrate for nitric oxide synthase, which synthesizes nitric oxide. Nitric oxide causes vasodilation, which leads to a decrease in systemic blood pressure.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Nitric oxide synthase produces nitric oxide from the substrate arginine. Therefore, arginine was likely the amino acid used in the experiment. Nitric oxide is a potent vasodilator, so the observed effects of blood vessel dilation and decreased blood pressure are consistent with the action of nitric oxide. The other amino acids listed are not known substrates for nitric oxide synthase.
We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Nitric oxide synthase utilizes arginine as a substrate to produce nitric oxide. Therefore, arginine was most likely used in this study.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Arginine is a substrate for nitric oxide synthase and is commonly used in studies related to nitric oxide. It is known to cause vasodilation and decrease systemic blood pressure. Histidine and tyrosine are not commonly used as substrates for nitric oxide synthase, and leucine is not involved in the production of nitric oxide.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, only arginine is used as a substrate for nitric oxide synthase, leading to the production of nitric oxide, which can cause vasodilation and decrease systemic blood pressure.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on nitric oxide for help. Arginine is a precursor to nitric oxide synthesis, and its supplementation can increase nitric oxide levels in the body, leading to vasodilation and decreased blood pressure. Histidine, Leucine, and Tyrosine are not known to be directly involved in nitric oxide synthesis in the body.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options given, only Arginine is a substrate for nitric oxide synthase, which means it can be used to produce nitric oxide. Nitric oxide causes vasodilation and decreases systemic blood pressure.

We refer to a study published in the Journal of Nutrition and Metabolism for help. The study found that supplementation with arginine resulted in increased nitric oxide levels and decreased blood pressure, supporting the findings in the question stem. None of the other options have been shown to significantly affect nitric oxide production or blood pressure in humans.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The amino acid isolates served as substrates for nitric oxide synthase, which synthesizes nitric oxide from arginine. Nitric oxide can cause vasodilation and decrease blood pressure. Therefore, arginine is the amino acid that was most likely used in this study.
